translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽(The method of exposition in the Paṭṭhāna is as follows:🔽The first section is the “direct” (anuloma) method of exposition.🔽The second section is the “reverse” (paccanīya) method of exposition.🔽The third section is the “duka” method of exposition.

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The fourth section is the “tika” method of exposition.

analyzed: kusala ttika hetu hetu sampayutta duka
translated: The fifth section is the “duka-tika” method of exposition.🔽The sixth section is the “tika-duka” method of exposition.🔽The seventh section is the “duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The eighth section is the “tika-tika” method of exposition.

original: Kusalaṁ hetuñceva hetusampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto🔽ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ hetuñceva hetusampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽naabyākato nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ
analyzed: kusalam hetum ca iva hetu sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ  ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam hetum ca iva hetu sampayuttañca dhammam paṭicca  na abyākataḥ na hetu ca iva na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusala
translated: The ninth section is the “duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The tenth section is the “duka-tika-duka” method of exposition.🔽The eleventh section is the “tika-duka-duka” method of exposition.

original: hetuñceva hetusampayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto🔽ca naabyākato nahetu ceva nahetuvippayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.

translated: The twelfth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.

analyzed: akusalam tīṇi kātabba abyākatam tīṇi kātabba
translated: The thirteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The fourteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The fifteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The sixteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The seventeenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The eighteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.

analyzed: hetuyāḥ nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: The nineteenth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka” method of exposition.🔽The twentieth section is the “duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-duka-

original: Kusalaṁ hetusampayuttañceva na ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahetuvippayutto
analyzed: kusalam hetu sampayuttam ca iva na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na hetu vippayuttaḥ
translated: Dependent on a profitable, causally-related, not causally-related idea, there is a non-profitable, causally-related, causally-related idea.🔽

original: ceva nanahetu ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ hetusampayuttañceva na ca🔽hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naabyākato nahetuvippayutto ceva nanahetu ca dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: ca iva na na hetu ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam hetu sampayuttam ca iva na ca  hetum dhammam paṭicca na abyākataḥ na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: With a wholesome root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arises what is unwholesome that is not associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause.

original: hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ hetusampayuttañceva na ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nahetuvippayutto🔽ceva nanahetu ca naabyākato nahetuvippayutto ceva nanahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: hetu paccayā kusalam hetu sampayuttam ca iva na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na hetu vippayuttaḥ  ca iva na na hetu ca na abyākataḥ na hetu vippayuttaḥ ca iva na na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a wholesome root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arises what is indeterminate that is not associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause.🔽With a wholesome root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arise what is wholesome that is not associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause and what is indeterminate that is not associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause. …

original: Akusalaṁ hetusampayuttañceva na ca hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca … tīṇi. Abyākataṁ … tīṇi. Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: akusalam hetu sampayuttam ca iva na ca hetum dhammam paṭicca tīṇi abyākatam tīṇi hetuyā nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: With an unwholesome root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arise … three. With an indeterminate root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arise … three. With a root-cause as condition, there are nine. … With an effect as condition, there are three. … With an unobscured-indeterminate root-cause that is associated with a root-cause and is not a root-cause as condition there arise … nine.
